items.summary: Ensure the public URL path `/assets/primepost.apk` in production serves the real Android APK binary (a valid ZIP/APK starting with the `PK` header), not an HTML/text response, and that the downloaded file installs on Android without the error message “There was a problem parsing the package.”

Update the production build/deploy workflow so that every deployment explicitly stages and includes `frontend/public/assets/primepost.apk` and `frontend/public/assets/primepost.apk.meta.json` generated from the latest Android build output, preventing missing/stale assets that cause `/assets/primepost.apk` to fall back to an HTML response.

Add an automated post-deploy verification step (using the existing optional `DEPLOY_URL` remote verification behavior in the APK build scripts) that checks the deployed `/assets/primepost.apk` and `/assets/primepost.apk.meta.json` for size/SHA-256 match and validates the deployed APK header is `PK`; fail the pipeline if the deployed asset is HTML, truncated, or mismatched.
